Sir Francis Bacon was born in London in 1521 and was an English statesman, philosopher, and statesman. He was known for his wit, eloquence, and his contribution to the Elizabethan era. Bacon was the Lord Keeper of the Privy Seal, and one of the leading members of the Elizabethan Court.
